title: Closing TB115 Mac OS not possible with CMD-Q on Mac
content:
After upgrading to TB115 I notice an issue where my TB does not close with CMD-Q (on Mac). It even show to CMD-F is configured (?!). But when trying CMF-F it shows the Find/Search function (as it should).

How can I change this back to CMD-Q.

PS: When using CMD-TAB to navigate between running apps it is possible to use CMD-Q to quit. However when TB is the active window it does not work...

Any ideas?

Many Thanks!
creator: Daantje

title: Unable to downgrade Thunderbird after failed TB Supernova installation
content:
Hello, I have many email accounts,Win10 64 bit. I made a backup copy of my default profile and then I upgraded to Supernova, the upgrade seemed succesful, but one of my POP accounts was never polled when downolading emails, Thunderbird skipped retrieving emails from that account. So I downgraded to 102.15.1 64 bit. But it says that the default profile could not be used because a newer version of TB could have modified it, so it forced me to create a new profile. But in the new profile I lost almost everything: sent emails, received emails, filters, archives. The only thing good is that TB 102 remembers the name of mail servers, so I did not have to configure them again. But I had to download again from the server some 6000 emails (I leave the emails on POP servers for some months, for security reasons), but I lost all sent emails and more. So my old, default profile is useless. What to do?

If I try to import it in Supernova it gets error: Uncaught (in promise) NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND: Component returned failure code: 0x80520012 (NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) [nsIFile.copyTo] 

   _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:659    _importMailMessages resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:588    _importServersAndAccounts resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:248

2 ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:659

title: Windows 11 Pro Thunderbird installation has no local profile
content:
Thunderbird appears to be installed and working correctly. I'd like to backup my profile and be able to repair it if needed. I installed Thunderbird 115.2.3 through the Windows App store. I believe that the program is actually installed at C:\Program Files\WindowsApps, which I cannot access even with elevated authority without disabling permissions I don't understand. I am reluctant to do this.

The Help > Troubleshooting Information page shows a < Open Folder > for my profile, but when I click it it says that C:/users/xxxxxxxx/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird/... doesn't exist. The File Explorer shows there is no C:\users\...\Thunderbird folder. How should I proceed?

Additional information:

I discovered this because I wanted to make a shortcut to put in my Startup folder (C:\Users\xxxxxx\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup) and couldn't find the program anywhere. There are 2 executable files ("*.exe") with a size of 0 bytes that I was able to find use to create a shortcut at: C:\Users\xxxxxxx\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WindowsApps C:\Users\xxxxxxx\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WindowsApps\MozillaThunderbird.xxxxxxxx It should be easy to create a shortcut for an executable.

Starting thunderbird at a command prompt to show the profiles says there are 2 profiles labelled < default-release > and <default >. default-release is highlighted.

title: Outgoing mail not working properly
content:
I have 4 email address/accounts setup in Thunderbird (V 115.3.0) that accesses email through my Spectrum/Charter carrier. I am running Win 10 with all latest updates on a desktop PC, AVG free AV, and Defender firewall.

After the last 2 Thunderbird updates, my outgoing mail has began to fail. It was working fine before the updates. I have checked all settings in TB and have found that all of the SMTP settings are entered correctly, except some settings keep changing automatically.

The problem has been traced to the Account Settings/Edit SMTP Server where the last line for User Name is NOT stable for all four accounts. When the Account Settings User Name in the SMTP Server setting matches the account User Name in the Server Settings menu, outgoing mail works fine. However, when I try to use one of the other email accounts to send an outgoing email, I then get the error message below:

“Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <warrenp3@charter.net> sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.”

I find that the User Name in the new 2nd email account now matches the User Name from the first email account. Now the 2nd outgoing email won’t work until I change the 2nd account’s User Name to match the 2nd email’s account. Unfortunately, changing the 2nd email setting with it’s own User Name then also changes the first email’s User Name to the 2nd one so that it now will get the above error message. I now have to back and forth like that in order to send emails from different accounts. No email account saves the User Name for it’s account nor do the passwords get saved for each account.

So help me resolve this issue. What can I do to correct these errors and get back to a usable email Thunderbird usage? HELP
creator: warrenp3

creator: pslonsky

title: Use of indents in email composition
content:
Is there some particular reason why the indent(s) in email composition have to be so completely screwed up!?

So, case(es) in point: [If I want to use a "Bulleted list"] Click on "* Bulleted list item"; OK, so exactly what is that supposed to accomplish?! Since I'm fully familiar with bulleted and numbered paragraph systems in word processing programs, I am used to; 1) entering the first line, bulleted/numbered, text, then; 2) after ENTER, having the next bulleted line appear for additional text; 3) continuing to build the bulleted text list as long as one desires; 4) if wanting an indented second level of text, merely pressing TAB key, which indents with either a bullet repeated, or an additional sub-symbol 5) the indented second/third/fourth level(s) of bulleted text ARE NOT treated as a new double-spaced paragraph, but rather just the next line in text. 6) attempting to use the OUTDENT Text or INDENT Text icons for such is a total waste of time, since the text may show up as a double-spaced paragraph, attempting to use TAB merely cancels the bullet symbol.

6) Further frustrating, is that if I attempt to use a TAB while writing this little missive, I am PROHIBITED from having a tab indent in this message, but will be ejected from this message and sent off to somewhere other in this webpage. Really, really a stupid design!
creator: Hikermann

title: No automatic line-feed at the end of the visible frame.
content:
Hello Thunderbird-Team,

if you watch this screen-video - see the link:

https://photos.onedrive.com/share/463603B35F32BD0D!31731?cid=463603B35F32BD0D&resId=463603B35F32BD0D!31731&authkey=!AFnGxbaq1ncCJxE&ithint=video&e=LkMpMq https://photos.onedrive.com/share/463603B35F32BD0D!31731?cid=463603B35F32BD0D&resId=463603B35F32BD0D!31731&authkey=!AFnGxbaq1ncCJxE&ithint=video&e=LkMpMq

, you will see soon the problem I had since the latest update. There is not an automatic line feed at the end of the visible frame, but somewhere later. You can easily understand, that this is a real problem, as you need to write some words blind, without having the chance to check this.

Remark: Due to ALS, I have to use the eye-tracker to write, as well as a special software. But the situation is the same, also with a standard keyboard.

I hope to find a checkbox in program-settings, which may solve this problem, but I didn't find.

What to do? Maybe "down-date" to the former version of thunderbird, in which everything was okay, with a line feet automatically at the end of the visible line?

title: Inbox is suddenly empty
content: Wow, just run Thunderbird and suddenly instead of 1200 or so messages in my inbox there's only one! Looking in "C:\Users\Test\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\98v8wen0.default\Mail\pop3.orcon.net.nz there's Inbox folder with size 1661360 KB In the same folder there is also inbox.msf of 186 kb . Both have today's date. Although I don't see any other inbox has TB changed to a new mail folder ? Anyone have any ideas please? Thanks
creator: kirkm

title: Two small issues that I can't seem to find help for.
content:
I have just recently moved and lost access to all my @shaw.ca accounts. I've created 2 new gmail.com accounts.

I've got both gmail accounts functioning in Thunderbird properly.

Here's my 2 issues... 1-I used to be able to hit "get messages" and have all 7 of my accounts checked with 1 click. Now I have to click the arrow beside "get messages" and select "get all". Is there some way to default the stupid button to just check everything?

2-I have a "local folders" folder, followed by a LOT of sub folders. Instead of using the "inbox" in local folders, both of my gmail accounts have their own folders and I can't seem to find a way to make them use the local folders collection. When I set up the accounts in Thunderbird I selected the choice to store emails on my PC and not to sync with gmail.

I'd love some help. Thanks for your time.
creator: HighlyConfused

title: Issue with Synchronizing Old Messages Recently Moved Back to Inbox
content:
Hello world!

I'm encountering a synchronization issue with my emails in Thunderbird and would greatly appreciate your guidance and advice. My use case is as follows:

I use Thunderbird as my primary email client to manage my Gmail account. I have a large number of messages in my Gmail inbox, and I am trying to archive older ones to free up space in the inbox and keep it manageable.

Here’s the workflow I am following: 

   I archive a set of older messages from my Gmail inbox (e.g., messages older than six months).    Later, I decide I need some of those archived messages back in the inbox. I move those selected messages back to the Inbox using Gmail’s web interface.    I notice that Thunderbird synchronizes these 'recently moved' messages back to the Inbox, even though they are older messages, seeming to prioritize them in the synchronization process.

My issue is that these 'recently moved' but older messages appear to be treated as recent by Thunderbird, getting synchronized, while other messages that are indeed more recent (by reception date) aren't immediately synchronized.

My questions are: 

   Is there a way to make Thunderbird synchronize strictly based on reception date and not on when messages were moved or modified?    Are there specific settings I should adjust in Thunderbird to achieve this desired synchronization behavior?

I appreciate your help and guidance in advance. I've gone through the documentation and support forums but haven't found a clear answer to this specific issue

Thanks!
creator: julian.fernandez

title: Impostazioni account, aggiungi account di posta
content: Buongiorno, non è possibile aggiungere l'account tecnasrl.vi@gmail.com a thunderbird in quanto il sistema restituisce l'errore in allegato. Attendo gentile riscontro Ringrazio Saluti Nicola Castagnaro - Tecna Srl
creator: tecnasrl.vi
